quest.name: Paved with Good Intentions
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
This lonesome lancer seems to be waiting for someone.
objectives: Express your /doubt to the belligerent broker.

dialogue.name: GUARD03448
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I didn't see you there. My master's absence weighs heavily on my mind.

dialogue.name: GUARD03448
dialogue.text: He is a powerful mage more than capable of protecting himself, but I cannot help but wonder what delays him.

dialogue.name: GUARD03448
dialogue.text: I plan to go and search for him, and your help would be greatly appreciated. If you should happen upon any mages of the Blessed in the woods, would you make sure they are all right?

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: The hells do you think you're doing? We've got wares to sell!

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: A spearman is searching for me? Ah, my apologies. My return from patrol was delayed by these two.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: They released some strange creature here in the woods, and tried to assault me before it could be subdued. As you might imagine, they refuse to tell me why they would release such a monstrosity.

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: You'll never get it out of me, you hear? Never!

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: They claim to be mere merchants, but I doubt the veracity of their words. Would that I could get them to speak the truth.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: I sincerely doubt they are mere merchants. Perhaps you could persuade them to speak?

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: The both of you can piss off! We didn't do anything wrong.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The belligerent broker refuses to reveal what mischief he has made in the Rak'tika Greatwood. Express your doubt and convince him to confess to his plans.

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: Wh-What are you looking at us like that for? We didn't do anything, I swear!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Glare daggers at them.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Disarm them with a charming glance.

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: Alright! Alright, I'll talk! Just don't hurt me, please!

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: Alright, I'll talk. How can I say no to a smile like that.

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: We brought an anemone with us, you see, and figured we could extract a fine poison from it after feeding it some of the toxic plants and critters these woods are known for.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: Why would you do such a thing?

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: Everywhere you look there's fighting, but never enough weapons to go around. Folks will pay well for a good poison.

dialogue.name: ROGUE03448
dialogue.text: But thanks to you, the anemone and all our profits are gone. I reckon it's about time we were gone too!

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: Wait!

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...I suppose it's fine, though there's still the matter of the anemone. First, I must return to Slitherbough. No doubt my pupil is beside himself with worry.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: You needn't worry about my pupil. He is returned and relieved to hear I am safe.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: As for the anemone, I spoke with my superiors, and I have been tasked with its capture.

dialogue.name: MENTOR03448
dialogue.text: I would ask your assistance, but I suspect a companion of Master Matoya has more pressing matters to attend to. Should you find yourself unoccupied, pray seek me out. I could use a womanman of your talents.
